attributes.action: Support families, by tackling the issue of inflated out-of-term holiday prices.
attributes.additional_details:
Children can be taken away on school-organised holidays, during term time; so why can parents not do then same?

The government needs to understand that parents take their children out of school for holidays not because they want too; it's because they cannot afford the drastically increased costs of out-of-term breaks.

Support should be provided because of this; by either authorising a reasonable absence percentage, or preventing travel companies from abusing the system for their own profits.
attributes.background:
The cost of taking a holiday out-of-term time is considerably more expensive than during the school-term itself.

Our government insists that education is vital to a child's development, but is happy to allow travel companies to profit by utilising this requirement to their financial advantage.
